summary: This bill, the Myakka Wild and Scenic River Act of 2025, designates a portion of the Myakka River in Sarasota County, Florida, as part of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. It outlines specific segments and their classifications (scenic, wild, recreational), and mandates the Secretary of the Interior to administer the river in partnership with the Myakka River Management Coordinating Council. The bill focuses on cooperative agreements and land management, with restrictions on land acquisition and condemnation. It also addresses the role of the Council and coordination between state and federal entities.
